org.jppf.node.event

Class TaskExecutionEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • org.jppf.node.event.TaskExecutionEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class TaskExecutionEvent
extends EventObject
    Instances of this class represent events that occur during the life span of an individual JPPF task.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.util.EventObject

        source

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskExecutionEvent(Task<?> task, String jobId, long cpuTime, long elapsedTime, boolean error)
      Initialize this event object with the specified task.
      TaskExecutionEvent(Task<?> task, String jobId, Object userObject, boolean sendViaJmx)
      Initialize this event object with the specified task.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Task<?> getTask()
      Get the JPPF task from which the event originates.
      TaskInformation getTaskInformation()
      Get the object encapsulating information about the task.
      Object getUserObject()
      Get the user-defined object to send as part of the notification.
      boolean isSendViaJmx()
      If true then also send this notification via the JMX MBean, otherwise only send to local listeners.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskExecutionEvent

        public TaskExecutionEvent(Task<?> task,
                  String jobId,
                  long cpuTime,
                  long elapsedTime,
                  boolean error)
        Initialize this event object with the specified task.
        Parameters:
        task - the JPPF task from which the event originates.
        jobId - the id of the job this task belongs to.
        cpuTime - the cpu time taken by the task.
        elapsedTime - the wall clock time taken by the task.
        error - determines whether the task had an exception.

      • TaskExecutionEvent

        public TaskExecutionEvent(Task<?> task,
                  String jobId,
                  Object userObject,
                  boolean sendViaJmx)
        Initialize this event object with the specified task.
        Parameters:
        task - the JPPF task from which the event originates.
        jobId - the id of the job this task belongs to.
        userObject - a user-defined object to send as part of the notification.
        sendViaJmx - if true then also send this notification via the JMX MBean, otherwise only send to local listeners.
        Since:
        4.0

    • Method Detail

      • getTask

        public Task<?> getTask()
        Get the JPPF task from which the event originates.
        Returns:
        a Task instance.

      • getTaskInformation

        public TaskInformation getTaskInformation()
        Get the object encapsulating information about the task.
        Returns:
        a TaskInformation instance.

      • getUserObject

        public Object getUserObject()
        Get the user-defined object to send as part of the notification.
        Returns:
        the object specified in the constructor or null.
        Since:
        4.0

      • isSendViaJmx

        public boolean isSendViaJmx()
        If true then also send this notification via the JMX MBean, otherwise only send to local listeners.
        Returns:
        true if this notification should be sent via JMX, false otherwise.
        Since:
        4.0
